name: Greater Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Turn Resistance
text: The zombie has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
text: The zombie makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Empowered Slam
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage and 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

description:
Many of those who brave the Tomb of Horrors believe they have reached their ultimate destination when they disturb a skeletal figure inside a secluded crypt. It is, in fact, a greater zombie, a creature magically created from a humanoid corpse to be far more resilient than a typical zombie.
Undead Nature. A zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
Source: Tales from the Yawning Portal p. 237, Essentials Kit: Divine Contention, Essentials Kit: Sleeping Dragon's Wake, Infernal Machine Rebuild
